Club 33: which is the private club in Disneyland's New Orleans Square, has been in operation since 1967 and is only open to members and their guests.
The club was originally intended as a pr: but it did not open until after Disney's death. It later became available to the public through limited memberships.
The Disney Parks blog has mentioned Club: including a profile in 2011 that provided a brief history of the venue.
According to Disneyland Food and Beverag: Walt Disney was inspired to create Club 33 after seeing executive lounges for corporate sponsors at the New York World's Fair. He wanted Disneyland to offer similar amenities and an exclusive setting with fine cuisine and a uniquely Disney atmosphere.
